intro: Orchis maculata var. schurii, commonly known as the spotted orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of violet or purple flowers with distinctive dark markings. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and meadows, thriving in nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish or purplish tinge. Orchis maculata var. schurii is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early summer.
